sen.j: 大宮通仮停車場（おおみやどおりかりていしゃじょう） - 京都駅開設前の約5ヶ月間、京都駅の西40チェーン (単位)の位置に置かれた仮駅。
sen.e: Omiya-dori temporary train station (Omiyadori-kari-teishajo): a provisional station which was at one time located at the distance of 40 chains (about 805m: 1chain=20.1168m) to the west form Kyoto Station, for about 5 months before the inauguration of Kyoto Station.
sen.cmt: 大宮通仮停車場（おおみやどおりかりていしゃじょう）→定訳不明 [Omiya-dori temporary train station（Omiyadori-kari-teishajo）としました]、 40チェーン→40 chains (about 805m: 1chain=20.1168m)と（）内を加えました。
sen.e: Omiya-dori temporary train station (Omiyadori-kari-teishajo), a provisional station that was once located at a distance of 40 chains (about 805m: 1chain=20.1168m) to the west from Kyoto Station, for about five months before the inauguration of Kyoto Station.

Omiya-dori temporary train station (Omiyadori-kari-teishajo), a provisional station that was once located at a distance of 40 chains (about 805 meters: 1chain=20.1168 meters) to the west from Kyoto Station, for about five months before the inauguration of Kyoto Station.
In 1877, it was disused.
In 1877 it ceased to be used.
